Description:
Bachelor's degree in Aeronautical/Aerospace/Mechanical Engineering with a minimum of 8 years' experience, including 4 years in Aircraft Maintenance Planning and 4 years in Maintenance Program and Reliability.
OR ICAO Type 2 License with 4 years of experience in Maintenance Program and Reliability.
OR Diploma in Aircraft Maintenance Engineering with 12 years of experience in CAMO, including 4 years in Maintenance Program and Reliability.
Formal training in Maintenance Program and Reliability Management is preferable.
Completed at least one General familiarization on Boeing 737 or Bombardier Global.
Strong knowledge of CAR M Subpart C and related regulations pertaining to Maintenance Program and Reliability.
Understanding of MSG 3 Aviation Maintenance Approach.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
Experience in Trax and CAMP is preferable.
Experience in performing comprehensive FRACAS, FMEA, RCA analyses on failed components is preferable.
Good understanding of current aircraft planning systems and techniques and their relation to aircraft maintenance programmes
Knowledge on Safety/Airworthiness Awareness and Civil Aviation regulationsJob Details
